title: Processes - Diff Eq Separation of Variables

content.question: Let <math alttext="y equals, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> be the particular solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, the fraction with numerator 3 times x squared, minus 1, and denominator 2 y, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with the initial condition <math alttext="f of 1, equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is an expression for <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, the square root of x cubed, minus x, end root, plus 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the square root of x cubed, minus x, plus 16, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, e raised to the 2 times x cubed, minus 2 x power, plus 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, 4 times e raised to 2 times x cubed, minus 2 x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, the square root of x cubed, minus x, plus 16, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.6: Finding General Solutions Using Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
